p: - Interferons, a family of cytokines with a central role in virus-directed innate immunity binds specific receptors and result in the expression of genes encoding protein with anti-viral or immunomodulatory properties. This sequence of events supported the therapeutic use of IFNs in some viral diseases such as chronic hepatitis, but also in non-viral conditions including leukemia and lymphoma, melanoma and multiple sclerosis [ 17, 18].
